intro: Moquilea humilis, commonly known as the Mexican mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that contain the seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Moquilea humilis thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is typically found in high-altitude regions. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and cultural contexts.
